tags.name: Credit Transfers
tags.description: Credit transfers are payments initiated by a debtor to transfer funds to a creditor's account.

tags.name: Direct Debits
tags.description: Direct debits are payments initiated by a creditor to collect funds from a debtor's account.

tags.name: External Accounts
tags.description: External accounts are financial accounts held by counterparties at financial institutions.

tags.name: Counterparties
tags.description: Counterparties are entities that the account holder has a relationship with.

tags.name: Mandates
tags.description: Mandates are authorizations given by a debtor to a creditor to collect funds from the account.

tags.name: Events (webhooks)
tags.description: Webhooks are automated notifications sent to a specified URL in response to events or changes.

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: Accounts are financial accounts held by your organization.

tags.name: Transactions
tags.description: Transactions are movements of funds that have been booked on an account.

tags.name: Pending Transactions
tags.description: Pending transactions are indications of movement of funds that may be booked on an account.

tags.name: Entities
tags.description: Entities are legal entities, e.g. companies.

get.description: Returns a list of credit transfers. Sort order is always descending on date.

parameters.description: Include only credit transfers for the given source account.
parameters.name: accountId

parameters.description: Include only credit transfers with the given status.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Include only credit transfers with property `date` matching the given value. The parameter value may be either a string for equality matching, or an object for range-like matching criteria.
parameters.name: date

oneOf.description: Include only credit transfers with `date` equal to the given value.

gte.description: Include only credit transfers with `date` after or equal to given date.

lte.description: Include only credit transfers with `date` before or equal to given date.

eq.description: Include only credit transfers with `date` equal to given date.

parameters.description: Include only credit transfers that are part of the payment batch with the given batch ID.
parameters.name: batchId

get.description: Retrieve a specific credit transfer.

patch.description:
Update a credit transfer.

The credit transfer execution date can only be changed if the
credit transfer has not been scheduled for submission yet.

get.description: Retrieve events for a specific credit transfer. Returns a list of events. For further details on Pagination, see the section above.

post.description:
Create a batch of credit transfer payments.

See https://docs.atlar.com/docs/batch-payments for more information.

get.description: Returns a list of credit transfer batches.

200.description: A list of credit transfer batches.

get.description: Retrieve a specific credit transfer batch.

List processing results for individual credit transfer requests that were part of a credit transfer batch. The result items represent the result(s) of processing the batch request input but doesn't not represent the end-to-end processing of the payment.

parameters.description:
Filter based on presence of `errors`. If `true`, only
results with at least one error will be included. If `false`, only
results with no errors will be included.
parameters.name: errors

parameters.description:
Filter based on `skipped`. If `true`, only results related
to input record that were skipped will be included. If
`false`, only results that are not related to skipped
input records will be included.
parameters.name: skipped

200.description: A list of payment batch results.

404.description:
Not found will be returned if no payment batch with given
id exists or if the payment batch is not yet in status
`COMPLETED`.

post.description:
Approve the batch of credit transfers.

Approval of a batch is only applicable when the batch `treatment` is `BATCH`.

202.description:
The request to approve the batch and all the payments it
contains has been accepted.

Note that the approval status of the individual payments
may be processed asynchronous.

post.description:
Reject the batch of credit transfers.

Rejection of a batch is only applicable when the batch `treatment` is `BATCH`.

202.description:
The request to reject the batch and all the payments it
contains has been accepted.

Note that the rejection status of the individual payments
may be processed asynchronous.

get.description: Returns a list of direct debits. For further details on Pagination, see general section above. Sort order is always descending on date.

parameters.description: Include only direct debits for the given destination account.
parameters.name: accountId

parameters.description: Include only direct debits with the given status.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Include only direct debits with property `date` matching the given value. The parameter value may be either a string for equality matching, or an object for range-like matching criteria.
parameters.name: date

oneOf.description: Include only direct debits with `date` equal to the given value.

gte.description: Include only direct debits with `date` after or equal to given date.

lte.description: Include only direct debits with `date` before or equal to given date.

eq.description: Include only direct debits with `date` equal to given date.

parameters.description: Include only direct debits with the given direct debit scheme.
parameters.name: scheme

get.description: Retrieve a specific direct debit.
Retrieve events for a specific direct debit. Returns a list of events. For further details on Pagination, see the section above.
Retrieve a specific external account.

post.description: Create an external account associated with a Counterparty. A maximum of 10 accounts can be created per counterparty.

get.description: Returns a list of external accounts. For further details on Pagination, see general section above.

parameters.description: Free text search of external account identifiers.
parameters.name: query

parameters.description: The ID of a counterparty.
parameters.name: counterpartyId

get.description: Returns a list of counterparties. For further details on Pagination, see general section above.

parameters.description: Free text search query term for counterparty name, account identifiers and external metadata. Must be at least 3 characters.
parameters.name: query

get.description: Retrieve a specific counterparty.

post.description: Create a new direct debit mandate.

get.description: Returns a list of mandates. For further details on Pagination, see general section above.

parameters.description: Include only mandates associated with the given external account.
parameters.name: externalAccountId

parameters.description: Include only mandates associated with the given counterparty.
parameters.name: counterpartyId

parameters.description: Include only mandates with the given status.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Include only mandates with the payment scheme.
parameters.name: scheme

get.description: Retrieve a specific mandate.
Retrieve events for a specific mandate. Returns a list of events. For further details on Pagination, see the section above.
Retrieve a specific account.

parameters.description: Account ID

get.description: Returns a list of accounts. For further details on Pagination, see general section above.
Returns a list of transactions. For further details on Pagination, see general section above.

parameters.description: Include only transactions associated with a given account.
parameters.name: accountId

parameters.description: Include only transactions with the given reconcilation status.
parameters.name: reconciliationStatus

parameters.description: Include only transactions with property `date` matching the given value. The parameter value may be either a string for equality matching, or an object for range-like matching criteria.
parameters.name: date

oneOf.description: Include only transactions with `date` equal to the given value.

gte.description: Include only transactions with `date` after or equal to given date.

lte.description: Include only transactions with `date` before or equal to given date.

eq.description: Include only transactions with `date` equal to given date.

get.description: Retrieve a specific transaction.

parameters.description: Transaction ID.
parameters.name: id

get.description: Returns a list of pending transactions. For further details on Pagination, see general section above.

parameters.description: Include only pending transactions associated with a given account.
parameters.name: accountId

parameters.description: Include only pending transactions with property `date` matching the given value. The parameter value may be either a string for equality matching, or an object for range-like matching criteria.
parameters.name: date

oneOf.description: Include only pending transactions with `date` equal to the given value.

gte.description: Include only pending transactions with `date` after or equal to given date.

lte.description: Include only pending transactions with `date` before or equal to given date.

eq.description: Include only pending transactions with `date` equal to given date.

get.description: Retrieve a specific pending transaction.

parameters.description: PendingTransaction ID.
parameters.name: id

get.description: Retrieve events for a specific pending transaction. Returns a list of events. For further details on Pagination, see the section above.
Returns a list of account balances. For further details on Pagination, see general section above.

parameters.description: Include only balances associated with the account identified by `id`. If value `-` is specified, balances across all accounts will be queried.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Include only balances of specified balance type (`BOOKED` or `AVAILABLE`).
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Include only the most recent balance.
parameters.name: mostRecent

get.description: Returns a list of entities. For further details on Pagination, see general section above.
Retrieve a specific entity.

parameters.description: Entity ID

delete.description: Deletes the specified entity. It is only possible to delete an entity if it has no children or has no associated accounts.

post.description: This endpoint is an OAuth 2.0 token endpoint and can be used by a client to obtain an access token. Use programmatic access user credentials as OAuth 2.0 client credentials. Use the access key as client identifier (`client_id`). Use the secret as client password (`client_secret`). This endpoint supports authentication using HTTP Basic auth. This endpoint only supports the OAuth 2.0 client credentials grant type.
Resource event delivered as a webhook request.

parameters.name: Webhook-Signature
parameters.description:
Atlar Webhook request signature.
Purpose: Makes it possible for your app to verify that the webhook was sent from Atlar (authenticity), and that the message hasn't been altered (integrity).
See details at https://docs.atlar.com/v2.0/docs/webhooks#webhook-security

parameters.name: Webhook-Request-Timestamp
parameters.description:
A timestamp specifying when the HTTP request was sent (by Atlar).
Purpose: Used to mitigate replay attacks.
See details at https://docs.atlar.com/v2.0/docs/webhooks#webhook-security

200.description: Return a 200 OK status to indicate that the data was received and processed successfully.

IfMatchETag.name: If-Match
IfMatchETag.description: ETag (version) of resource to be updated.

QueryLimit.name: limit
QueryLimit.description: Limit the number of items in resulting query response.

PaginationToken.name: token
PaginationToken.description: If a query response contains a non-empty `nextToken`, use that value as `token` query parameter to continue pagination.

ResourceIDOrExternalID.name: id
ResourceIDOrExternalID.description: Atlar resource ID or External ID. Prefix External IDs with `external:`.

CreatedTimestamp.description: Time at which the resource was created.

UpdatedTimestamp.description: Time at which the resource was last updated.

ResourceVersion.description:
Resource version. Starts at value `1` when the resource is
created and increases by one for each successive update.

ETag.description:
[ETag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_ETag) based on the
resource version. This can be passed along in `If-Match` HTTP
header when updating a resource to perform a conditional
update.

OrganizationID.description: Unique resource identifier for an Organization.

nextToken.description:
Pagination token for next page.
The value will be a non-empty string if there are more resources to be fetched.
The value will be an empty string if there are no more resources to be fetched.

token.description:
The pagination token that was used for this request.
The value will be an empty string if no `token` query parameter was provided with the request.

limit.description: The page limit that was used for this request.

entityId.description: The ID of the API resource that this event belongs to.

name.description: The event name. Different resources have different sets of event names.

message.description: A message which could either be a message from the bank or an explanation of the event.

originator.description: The originator of the event which could be either a user ID, BANK or ATLAR.

ExternalID.description: External ID is optional to use, but if used, the Atlar platform will persist it, index it, as well as require it to be unique across all resources. It is possible to retrieve a resource using the external ID using the prefix `external:`.

stringValue.description:
A string representation of the amount value. This will be
a decimal number if the currency has decimals. The number
is not formatted for display purposes (e.g. with locale
specific thousand separator) and always contains the dot
`.` character as decimal separator.

value.description:
The amount value as an integer (int64) represented in
currency minor units (e.g. 15.02 EUR is represented as the
value 1502).

Date.description: `full-date` notation as defined by [RFC 3339, section 5.6](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.6), for example, `2017-07-21`.

value.description: The amount value as an integer (int64) represented in currency minor units (e.g. 15.02 EUR is represented as the value 1502).

stringValue.description: A string representation of the amount value, which will be a decimal number if the currency has decimals. The number is not formatted for display purposes (e.g. with thousand separator) and always contains the dot `.` character as decimal separator.

AccountIdentifierType.description:
Account Identifier type. Choose among:
  • IBAN International Bank Account Number
  • NUMBER A NUMBER is a domestic account number. Different markets will have different look & feel of account numbers. For instance a Swedish NUMBER will be a clearing number (4-5 digits) plus account number concatenated, while a UK NUMBER will only be the 8-digit account number, no sort-code.
  • SE_BANKGIRO (Swedish BankGiro number)
  • SE_PLUSGIRO (Swedish PlusGiro number)
  • DK_FIK Danish FIK creditor number
  • ADYEN Adyen specific account identifier
  • PAYPAL PayPal specific account identifier
  • SOLDO Soldo specific account identifier
  • WALLET_SWISSQUOTE Swissquote specific wallet account identifier
  • WALLET_AIRWALLEX Airwallex specific wallet account identifier
  • WALLET_HYPERWALLET Hyperwallet specific wallet account identifier
  • WALLET_PAYHAWK Payhawk specific wallet account identifier
  • WALLET_STRIPE Stripe specific wallet account identifier
  • AU_BPAY_BILLER_CODE Australian BPAY biller code
For further information please refer to Account Identifiers

market.description:
The market of the `AccountIdentifier` specifies in which market-context the identifier should be treated.

A `NUMBER` from Sweden does not look and does not validate in the same way as a `NUMBER` from GB. The market
code is, in most cases, the same as where the account itself is domiciled, but not necessarily. An examples
of this discrepancy is Jersey which may have domiciled accounts with market `JE`, but the account identifier
would be an `IBAN` with country code `GB`.

number.description: The unformatted identifier itself. For type `NUMBER` the structure of the account number is country-specific.

invalid.description: Will be `true` if the account identifier is invalid according to Atlar account identifier validation rules.

RoutingIdentifierType.description: A routing identifier of type `BIC` must be provided to support cross-border/SWIFT payments.

number.description: The form of the routing number depends on `type`. E.g. for `BIC` the value should be an 8 or 11 character BIC/SWIFT code. For `GB_DSC` (UK domestic routing) the value should be a six digit sort code.

invalid.description: Will be `true` if the routing identifier is invalid according to Atlar validation rules.

CounterpartyAccount.description: Account information about the counterparty in the transaction.

partyType.description: The legal type of the counterparty.

rawAddressLines.description: International unstructured address lines, as they might appear on a mailing label.

code.description: An error code for this error. Not always present.

error.description: A description of this specific error.
error.example: Must be one of [direct_debits mandates payments]

field.description: The field which has an error. This only set if the error has to do with a specific field, such as for validation errors. Nested fields are concatenated with `.`, as well as indexed fields in lists.

message.description: A top-level message describing the error(s).
message.example: There is some problem with the data you submitted.

details.description: A list of details for each error that occurred.

BatchAmountSums.description:
The total amount sum per each currency of resources in this batch.

Note that batch amount sums reported on the batch input metadata
refer to the total amount sums of the input records (resources)
while the batch amount sums reported on the batch result refer
to the total amount sums of the successfully processed records (resources).
This means that there may be a difference in the total sum for the input
vs the result, due to skipped records (resources).

BatchInputContent.description: Metadata describing the input contents that was used to create this batch.

recordCount.description: Total count of input records (resources) in the input batch.

size.description:
The size of the input content in bytes.

If the batch was created by uploading a file using `multipart/form-data` the `contentSize` will be the file size.

If the batch was created with JSON input this will be the raw JSON size.

checksum.description:
A checksum of the batch input contents.

The checksum digest value will be prefixed by an
identifier of the hash algorithm used, e.g. `sha256`. A
colon `:` is used as separator between the algorithm
identifier and the digest value.

filename.description:
The name of the file that was used as input to create the batch.

Filename will only available if the batch input was provided using `multipart/form-data`.

BatchErrors.description: A list of error details if the batch failed. Only populated once the batch has reached status `COMPLETED`. Only the first 255 errors (if any) will be present in this list. If there are more errors, the complete list can be retrieved using the results endpoint for the batch.

BatchResultSummary.description: Aggregate summary of batch processing results.

total.description: Number of input records that were attempted to be processed.

succeeded.description: Number of input records that resulted in a successfully created resource.

skipped.description: Number of input records that were skipped.

BatchStatus.description:
The status of this batch. The status only refers to the
processing of the input, not the processing or success of
the resources themselves.

`COMPLETED` is the only end-state. Failure is indicated by a non-empty list of `errors`.

Metadata.description:
Metadata is a `string-string` key-value container that
can be used to store information known at the time of resource
creation. This can be retrieved later on, for instance when a
payment or expected transaction is reconciled with the booked
transaction on the bank statement.

Metadata can have at most 12 entries. Keys may have a
maximum length of 64 chars and values a maximum length of 512
chars.

By default, this field is optional. It is possible to make it
required in the Atlar Dashboard by visiting the [Metadata keys
page](https://app.atlar.com/metadata-keys). Requirement rules
can be specified per API resource. Both the Dashboard and the
API will then enforce these rules and give validation errors
when the required fields are not set.

ForecastedTransactionBatchContentType.description: The content type of the batch.

PartyType.description: The legal type of a party

ProprietaryBankTransactionCode.description: Proprietary bank transaction codes are provided when the bank provides a proprietary transaction code. This field will be set as the code provided by the bank.

domain.description: ISO 20022 BTC Domain - Defines the business area of the underlying transaction, e.g. payments or cash management.

family.description: ISO 20022 BTC Family - May for example define the type of transaction, e.g. credit transfer or direct debit.

subfamily.description: ISO 20022 BTC Subfamily - May for example specify a scheme specific transaction type, e.g. SEPA credit transfer, or a Cross-Border credit transfer.

description.description: Free-form textual description of the Bank Transaction Code.

originalBankTransactionCode.description: Bank transaction code (BTC) of original transaction.

exchangeRate.description: The exchange rate that was reported by the bank. Atlar will not try to calculate this in cases where the information isn't present.

sourceCurrency.description: The currency from which the amount was converted.

targetCurrency.description: The currency to which the amount was converted.

unitCurrency.description: One unit of this currency multiplied by the exchange rate will equal the target currency.

AccountType.description: Account type specifier. `ACCOUNT` for internal _Account_ resources. `EXTERNAL_ACCOUNT` for _External Account_ resources.

MandateSnapshot.description: Mandate information about the mandate to be used for a Direct Debit. This mandate data is a snapshot of the state of the mandate at the time when the Direct Debit was created.

id.description: The unique identifier of this mandate.

creditorReference.description: The customer number that you have received from the bank.

mandateReference.description: A unique reference to the mandate that you have signed with the debtor.

finalCollection.description:
Whether to consider this Direct Debit collection the final one for this mandate. 
This field is set automatically by the Atlar platform if the mandate has been cancelled prior to the creation of the Direct Debit.
This field only affects certain direct debit schemes (e.g. SEPA DDs), 
where the bank is notified about the mandate cancellation in relation to the final collection.

signatureDate.description: The date that this mandate was signed by the end user.

CreditTransferSchemeType.description:
Payment scheme. Choose among:
  • SCT (SEPA Credit Transfer)
  • SCT_INST (SEPA Instant Credit Transfer)
  • CROSS_BORDER (Swift)
  • GB_CT_BACS (UK account-to-account BACS)
  • GB_CT_CHAPS (UK account-to-account CHAPS)
  • GB_CT_FPS (UK account-to-account Faster Payments)
  • SE_A2A (Swedish account-to-account)
  • SE_GIRO (Swedish Bankgiro and/or PlusGiro)
  • DK_A2A (Danish account-to-account)
  • DK_CT_SAMEDAY (Danish same-day credit transfer)
  • DK_CT_INST (Danish instant credit transfer)
  • DK_CT_FIK71 (Danish FIK71 credit transfer)
  • DK_CT_FIK73 (Danish FIK73 credit transfer)
  • DK_CT_FIK75 (Danish FIK75 credit transfer)
  • CH_CT (Swiss account-to-account)
  • NO_CT (Norwegian account-to-account)
  • NO_CT_KID (Norwegian KID payment)
  • US_CT_ACH (US ACH)
  • US_CT_ACH (US Wire)
  • IS_CT (Icelandic account-to-account)
  • AU_CT (Australian account-to-account)
  • AU_CT_BPAY (Australian BPAY)
  • IL_CT (Israel account-to-account)
  • SG_CT (Singapore account-to-account)
  • BG_CT (Bulgarian account-to-account)
  • MX_CT (Mexican account-to-account)
  • KR_CT (South Korean account-to-account)
  • TH_CT (Thai account-to-account)

DirectDebitSchemeType.description:
Direct debit payment scheme. Choose among:
  • SDD_CORE (SEPA Direct Debit Core)
  • SDD_B2B (SEPA Direct Debit B2B)
  • AUTOGIRO (Swedish Bg AutoGiro)

InstrumentType.description: The type of the payment instrument.

citiWorldlinkId.description: The WorldLink ID assigned to the account to initiate payments.

usAchCompanyId.description: The US ACH Company ID assigned to the account to initiate US ACH payments.

Instrument.description: The payment instrument used to initiate the payment. For example Citi has a proprietary payment instrument called WorldLink, which can be used to initiate payments.

ChargeBearer.description: Charge bearer specifies which party should bear the charges of the transaction.

RegulatoryReportingIndicator.description: Determines which side of the payment the regulatory reporting code applies to. When making a payment _to_ Thailand, one should supply a `CREDITOR` code (equivalent to iso20022 `CRED`), while making a payment _out of_ Sweden or Norway may require a `DEBTOR` code (equivalent to iso20022 `DEBT`).

code.description: The actual code to report. Codes are market-specific and found on https://docs.atlar.com

ExternalAccountRef.description: A reference to an External Account.

InlineExternalAccount.description: An inline-defined (from the point of the payment) Account. This is used in the context of payment initiation.

InlineAccountHolder.description: Information about the legal holder of an account.

legalName.description: The legal name of the account holder. Some banks, and for some payment schemes, the correctness of the legal name will be validated and payments may be rejected if legal names do not match.

AccountHolder.description: Information about the legal holder of an account.

id.description: Resource ID of either a `Counterparty` or an `Entity`.

legalName.description: The legal name of the account holder. Some banks, and for some payment schemes, the correctness of the legal name will be validated and payments may be rejected if legal names do not match.

address.description: Postal address of the account holder.

nationalIdentifier.description: The national identifier of the account holder.

partyType.description: The party type of the account holder.

ExternalAccount.description: An `ExternalAccount` represents an account that does not belong to your organization. A `Counterparty` can have multiple external accounts.

counterpartyId.description: The ID of the counterparty to which this external account belongs.

name.description:
Name of the account.

This is a read-only derived property. It will take the value of `alias` if `alias` is set, otherwise it will be a display name derived from the account number(s).

alias.description: An additional name, an alias, for the account.

counterpartyId.description: The ID of the counterparty to which this external account belongs.

alias.description: An additional name, an alias, for the account.

ExternalAccountJSONPatchRequest.description: JSON Patch request to update an external account.

Counterparty.description: A counterparty represents a person or a legal business entity.

legalName.description: Legal name of the counterparty. E.g. a company's legal business name, or an individual's full legal name.

alias.description: An additional name, an alias, for the counterparty.

nationalIdentifier.description: The national identifier of the counterparty.

entityIds.description: An optional list of entity IDs that this counterparty belongs to. If empty, the counterparty is not associated with any specific entity and can be used by all in the organization.

legalName.description: Legal name of the counterparty. E.g. a company's legal business name, or an individual's full legal name.

alias.description: An additional name, an alias, for the counterparty.

accounts.description: An optional list of external accounts to create for this counterparty. Note that external account is a separate API resource. One counterparty can have multiple external accounts.

nationalIdentifier.description: The national identifier of the counterparty.

entityIds.description: An optional list of entity IDs that this counterparty belongs to. If empty, the counterparty is not associated with any specific entity and can be used by all in the organization.

CounterpartyJSONPatchRequest.description: JSON Patch request to update a counterparty.

requiredRoleIds.description: IDs of the Roles that can approve/reject.

allowCreatorApproval.description: Allow approval by the user creating a resource. By default this is not allowed to conform with a four-eyes principle where approval by another person is required.

AmountConditionInput.description: Amount condition that will trigger the chain.

convertCurrency.description: If true, the amount will be converted to the currency of the payment before comparison.

IdEqualityCondition.description: Amount condition that will trigger the chain.

in.description: Payments created by with these IDs will trigger the chain.

notIn.description: Payments created by with these IDs will NOT trigger the chain.

CreatorRoleCondition.description: Trigger condition based on the creator role.

InitiatingEntityCondition.description: Trigger condition based on the entity of the initiating account.

AmountCondition.description: Amount condition that will trigger the chain.

convertCurrency.description: If true, the amount will be converted to the currency of the payment before comparison.

Mandate.description: A mandate is a contract between the debtor and the creditor that authorizes debit collections from the debtors account. Different mandate types exist for different debit schemes.

id.description: The unique identifier of this mandate.

counterpartyId.description: The ID of the counterparty which owns this mandate.

externalAccountId.description: The ID of the external account to which this mandate is associated with.

destinationAccountId.description: The ID of the destination account where money will be collected for this mandate. This is only required for `AUTOGIRO` mandates.

connectionInstructionId.description: The ID of the instruction that was sent to the bank where this mandate was included when it was created. Subsequent instructions, such as mandate cancellations, won't update this ID. It will always refer to the instruction which created the resource.

source.description: Source account from which funds will be collected. This account will be debited.

creditorReference.description: The customer number that you have received from the bank.

mandateReference.description: A unique reference to the mandate that you have signed with the debtor.

signatureDate.description: The date that this mandate was signed by the end user.

status.description: The current status of a mandate.

active.description: Set this to true if this mandate is already known by the bank. This is for example a good option if you're migrating a lot of mandates that you know are already active. The actual outcome of using this flag depends on the direct debit scheme, since all schemes work in slightly different ways. For example, for `AUTOGIRO`, it means that Atlar won't send the mandate prior to making the collection. For other schemes, it could have an effect on how quickly the collection can be executed.

externalAccountId.description: The ID of the external account to which this mandate is associated with.

destinationAccountId.description: The ID of the destination account where money will be collected for this mandate. This is only required for `AUTOGIRO` mandates.

creditorReference.description:
The customer number that you have received from the bank.
For `AUTOGIRO` this is your 6 digit customer number.

mandateReference.description:
A unique reference to the mandate that you have signed with the debtor.
For `AUTOGIRO` this is used as payer number associated with the mandate and validated as 1-16 digits. For `AUTOGIRO`, this reference must not contain leading 0's.

signatureDate.description: The date that this mandate was signed by the end user.

PaymentReference.description: This reference will be sent to the destination bank and recipient. (This type of reference is sometimes also referred to as remittance information.)

BatchTreatmentType.description:
The way this batch treats the underlying payments.

`INDIVIDUAL_PAYMENTS` means that each payment is treated individually.

`BATCH` means that payment approvals (or rejections) are handled at batch level.

BatchResult.description:
Result of processing an individual payment request as part of
a batch request.

paymentId.description:
ID of the payment (a credit transfer or direct debit
resource). Present if the result represent the successful
creation of a credit transfer or direct debit resource.

skipped.description:
Indicates whether a given payment request was skipped when
processed as part of a batch.

recordIndex.description:
0-based index specifying which record in the batch input that
this result is associated with. If the batch input was a
CSV file the `recordIndex` will refer to rows (lines) in
the file. If the batch input was JSON it will refer to
JSON array indicies.

If the error(s) are not directly related to a specific
record/row/line the `recordIndex` will not be present.

BatchResultsSummary.description: Aggregate summary of payment batch processing results.

total.description: Deprecated. Moved to `processed`. Number of input records that were attempted to be processed.

succeeded.description: Deprecated. Moved to `processed`. Number of input records that resulted in a successfully created payment.

failed.description: Deprecated. Moved to `processed`. Number of failed records.

skipped.description: Deprecated. Moved to `processed`. Number of input records that were skipped.

id.description: The ID of this step. Used when approving/rejecting.

approvalChainId.description: The ID of the approval chain that triggered this approval step.

requiredRoleIds.description: IDs of the Roles that can approve/reject. Not specified if the step was automatically approved based on an auto-approval chain.

status.description: The status of the approval step. `PENDING` if step is not yet interacted with.

approver.description: User information about the user who approved/rejected. Omitted if step is not yet approved/rejected.

updated.description: Timestamp when approved/rejected. Omitted if the step is not yet approved/rejected.

allowCreatorApproval.description: Allow approval by the user creating this resource if they have the role required for this step. By default, this is not allowed to conform with a four-eyes principle where approval by another person is required.

ApprovalStatus.description: The status of the approval step.

approvalStepId.description: The id of the approval step to be approved.
The id of the approval step to be approved.

reason.description: An optional rejection reason that will propagate to the reject event on the payment.

examples.reason: This has been classified as a fraudulent payment

name.description: User given name(s) information. May be a concatenation of firstname, lastname etc.

PaymentStatus.description: Status of a payment. Applicable to both credit transfer payments and direct debit payments.

AttachedTransactionRef.description: An association between a _transactable_ payment resource, e.g. a _Credit Transfer_, _Direct Debit_, or _Expected Transaction_, and an account _Transaction_.

type.description: The resource type of the attached transaction

id.description: ID of the attached transaction resource.

creatorUserId.description: ID of the user that created the credit transfer.

source.description: Source account from which funds will be withdrawn. This account will be debited.

destination.description: Destination account to which funds will be sent. This account will be credited.

connectionInstructionId.description: The ID of the instruction that was sent to the bank in which this credit transfer was included when it was created.

batch.description: Details of the associated payments batch if the credit transfer was created as part of a batch.

CreditTransferDestination.description: A reference identifying the destination account. Can be either an internal or an external account.

date.description: Requested payment execution date. It is a local date from the source account's point-of-view. Cannot be set to before the current date, and not more than 60 days into the future.

source.description: A reference identifying the source account (as found from `/financial-data/v2/accounts`).

regulatoryReporting.description: Regulatory reporting can be used to provide additional information when needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements.

CreditTransferJSONPatchRequest.description: JSON Patch request to update a credit transfer.

CreditTransferJSONPatchReplaceStatus.description: Change payment status. This is forcing a status change and is by-passing the standard Atlar payment state/status machine.

results.description:
Deprecated - use `resultSummary` and `resultDetails`. Summary of processing results.

The summary is only populated when the batch `status` is `COMPLETED`.

Detailed processing results can be retrieved using
https://docs.atlar.com/v2.0/reference/get_payments-v2beta-credit-transfer-batches-id-results.

approvalSteps.description:
Batch approval steps.

Approval steps will only be available once the the batch
`status` is `COMPLETED`. I.e. no action must be taken
based on the absence of approval steps (empty array).

CreditTransferBatchContentType.description:
The content type of the batch.

See https://docs.atlar.com/docs/batch-payments#csv-format for details on the CSV format for credit transfer batches.

creatorUserId.description: ID of the user that created the direct debit.

destination.description: Destination account which will receive funds. This account will be credited.

source.description: Source account from which funds will be collected. This account will be debited.

mandate.description: The mandate which represents the end user's consent to executing this direct debit.

connectionInstructionId.description: The ID of the instruction that was sent to the bank in which this direct debit was included when it was created.

date.description: Requested payment execution date. It is a local date from the source account's point-of-view. Cannot be set to before the current date, and not more than 60 days into the future.

source.description: A reference identifying the source account to collect money from. Can only be an external account.

DirectDebitJSONPatchReplaceStatus.description: Change payment status. This is forcing a status change and is by-passing the standard Atlar payment state/status machine.

EventWebhookPayload.description: A resource event payload when sent as a webhook.

entity.description: A snapshot of the resource entity, after the event / changes impacted the entity.

apiVersion.description: Atlar API (major) version. This toghether with the `resource` dictates the structure of `entity`.

thirdPartyId.description: ID of the associated third-party, e.g. the bank in which the account is held.

affiliationId.description: ID of the affiliation. An affiliation is and describes the relationship between the legal entity (`entityId`) owning this account and the third-party (`thirdPartyId`) where the account is held (e.g. a bank).

entityId.description: ID of the associated legal Entity.

name.description: Name of the account automatically populated by Atlar.

alias.description: An additional name, an alias, for the account.

fictive.description: Indicates whether the account is a fictive/test account. This will be `true` for accounts associated with the Atlar _Testbank_.

localDate.description: Local date in the timezone associated with the account/bank.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the balance entry was recorded on the account. This timestamp is reported in UTC and thus the date component of this timestamp may be different than `localDate`.

accountId.description: The ID of the account which the transaction is booked on.

date.description: Booking date of the transaction on your account. This is a local date with no timezone from your account's point-of-view.

reference.description: Transaction reference. (This type of reference is sometimes also referred to as remittance information.)

description.description:
In most cases, the description will contain the same value (text) as the remittance information.
If the remittance information lacks clarity or meaning, the description can be derived from
the bank transaction code instead. This description field is intended solely for displaying
a meaningful description to users.

instructedAmount.description: The amount that the initiator of the transaction instructed.

valueDate.description: Value date of the transaction on your account. This is a local date with no timezone from your account's point-of-view.

returned.description: Whether or not the transaction is considered a return or reversal.

returnReason.description: Populated if the transaction is a return transaction, e.g. a payment reversal/return.

currencyExchange.description: If any currency conversion happened at the bank holding the account, conversion details may be present here.

virtualAccount.description: If a virtual account was used for the transaction the details of that virtual account may be present here.

accountId.description: The ID of the account which the transactions occurs on.

date.description: The booking date of the transaction on your account. This is a local date with no timezone from your account's point-of-view. NB! This is a PendingTransaction, and not an actual reported Booked Transaction. This date may differ from the actual booking date of the transaction.

reference.description: Transaction reference. (This type of reference is sometimes also referred to as remittance information.)

description.description:
In most cases, the description will contain the same value (text) as the remittance information.
If the remittance information lacks clarity or meaning, the description can be derived from
the bank transaction code instead. This description field is intended solely for displaying
a meaningful description to users.

instructedAmount.description: The amount that the initiator of the transaction instructed.

valueDate.description: Value date of the transaction on your account. This is a local date with no timezone from your account's point-of-view. NB! This is a PendingTransaction, and not an actual reported Booked Transaction. This date may differ from the actual value date of the booked transaction.

returned.description: Whether or not the transaction is considered a return or reversal.

returnReason.description: Populated if the transaction is a return transaction, e.g. a payment reversal/return.

currencyExchange.description: If any currency conversion happened at the bank holding the account, conversion details may be present here.

virtualAccount.description: If a virtual account was used for the transaction the details of that virtual account may be present here.

TransactionReferences.description: References and identifiers associated with a transaction.

mandateReference.description: Populated if a (debit) mandate reference was given on the transaction by the bank. Typically, if a transaction stems from a direct debit payment, the mandate reference that was used to pull the funds will be given.

endToEndId.description: A reference that can be set by the payment initiator that should follow the payment "end to end". Atlar will utilize this reference for tracking payments.

TransactionVirtualAccount.description: Account information about the virtual account used in the transaction.

AttachedTransactableRef.description: An association between a _Transaction_ and a _transactable_ resource, e.g. a _Credit Transfer_, _Direct Debit_, _Expected Transaction_, or _Payment Batch_.

type.description: The resource type of the attached transactable.

id.description: ID of the attached transactable resource.

TransactionReconciliationStatus.description: Specifies whether the transaction have been reconciled against a payment or an expected transaction.

parentId.description: This optional field identifies a parent entity, indicating this entity is a subsidiary or branch to the parent. A missing Parent Entity ID implies the entity is without parent company.

legalName.description: Legal name of the entity. E.g. your company's legal business name.

parentId.description: Parent Entity ID, if applicable. Set the parent entity ID if the entity is a subsidiary or a branch of another entity.

AccountJSONPatchReplaceEntity.description: Change the holder entity of this Account.

AccountJSONPatchReplaceMetadataKey.description: Set or replace the value of a specific metadata key.

AccountJSONPatchAddPaymentOptionsInstrum.description: Add an instrument to payment options.

AccountJSONPatchReplacePaymentOptionsIns.description: Replace an instrument in payment options.

AccountJSONPatchRemovePaymentOptionsInst.description: Remove an instrument from payment options.

TransactionJSONPatchReplaceMetadataKey.description: Set or replace the value of a specific metadata key.

expires_in.description: The lifetime in seconds of the access token.

error.description: OAuth 2.0 error code. See a RFC 6749 for details.

error_description.description: Human readable description of the error.

example.message: There is some problem with the data you submitted.

x-tagGroups.name: Payments
x-tagGroups.description: The Payments API provides functionality for processing payments and handling payment-related operations.

x-tagGroups.name: Financial Data
x-tagGroups.description: The Financial Data API provides access to bank account data, e.g. account balances and account transactions.

x-tagGroups.name: IAM
x-tagGroups.description: The IAM API provides endpoints for managing identity providers and roles.
